context_bundle.summary: Neuropsychology: Brain-behavior relationships, localization vs networks, neuropsych assessment batteries (Halstead-Reitan, NEPSY), lesion studies, functional neuroimaging (fMRI, PET), plasticity and rehabilitation.

onboarding.quick_start: Function emerges from networks, not just regions. Double dissociations reveal distinct systems. Assessment batteries sample multiple domains. Plasticity enables rehabilitation but has limits.
common_patterns: Localization: Broca's (speech production), Wernicke's (comprehension), hippocampus (memory encoding), prefrontal (executive)
Networks: Default mode (self-referential), salience (attention switching), central executive (cognitive control)
Assessment: Attention, memory, language, visuospatial, executive function - pattern analysis for localization
Plasticity: Experience-dependent, compensation vs restoration, critical periods but lifelong capacity
known_errors: Strict localizationism - networks matter more than single regions
Assuming imaging = understanding - correlation not mechanism
Ignoring individual differences - same lesion, different outcomes
Rehabilitation nihilism - plasticity enables meaningful recovery
